body:
@jeremy Thanks for checking this out.

My commit isn't needed for master as `TableAlias` has an `engine` method in arel master. In fact I've just altered my commit to leave @dylanahsmith's test alone so you can simply apply [his branch][dylans-branch] to master and [our branch][our-branch] to 3-2.

[dylans-branch]: https://github.com/dylanahsmith/rails/tree/fix-join-alias-integer-comparison
[our-branch]: https://github.com/howaboutwe/rails/tree/3.2.12-join-regression

I won't dispute the jankiness. I don't have very intimate knowledge of arel, but it kinda begs for an attribute node that knows the name and type of the attribute. Seems like a lot of work, though, and likely a performance hit.
